result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice Dwayne Hatchett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In lieu of payment, defendant is to serve an additional 10 days jail, CONSECUTIVE.    Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Straight Time.
Apply 80 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Present revocation sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice Dwayne Hatchett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Maurice Dwayne Hatchett in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis. 

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.



Court orders the following:
7 Months in the Waukesha County Jail.
80 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  Present Revocation.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid FORTHWITH - In Lieu of payment defendant to serve an additional  10 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Consecutive.


Defendant to be transferred to DCI - FORTHWITH.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Maurice Dwayne Hatchett in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty of count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Repeater enhancer is struck.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.

Matter put over for sentencing to comply with victim notification.
Court orders the defendant remain here pending sentencing.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant has had his revocation hearing last week and is just waiting on the decision.
  Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.    Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
